intro: Drepanocarpus macrophyllus, commonly known as the broad-leafed ironwood, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and woody structure. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by small, dry fruits. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes or as a source of durable timber.
